turn.0: ELI5: Why was Harvey Weinstein convicted and sentenced to 23 years in prison?
turn.1: First of all, would it make you happier if I said “beyond a reasonable doubt,” since you’re very hung up on the semantics?
turn.2: Yes, actually it would. We're talking about someone being deprived of their freedom for 23 years. If there's a place for correctness, it is this one.  Address the second point please.
turn.3: I have no information besides what you have as regards the second point.
turn.4: In other words, Weinstein was convicted based on a rumour.
turn.5: I have no idea if this is the case. Because I do not have information on something does not mean that it was done with ill intent. I also don’t know how string theory was developed, but I don’t think it was done illicitly just because I don’t know about it.
